Package chess.model

Class Colored

java.lang.Object
chess.model.Colored
All Implemented Interfaces:
chess.persistence.Codable
Direct Known Subclasses:
Movable, Piece, Player
public abstract class Colored extends Object implements chess.persistence.Codable
An abstract entity that is to be inherited by any object that plays a color-dependent role in a Chess game, including but may not be limited to all concrete subtypes of Player, Piece, and Movable.

Any colored object possesses a binary color property, i.e. either White or Black, represented by Color.

See Also:

    • Colored

      public Colored(org.json.JSONObject jsonObject)
      Constructs this Colored object from a JSON object containing the following required key-value mappings: 
       {
     "color":"<color>",
     ...
 }
      where:
      • <color>: a string Color value, one of "White" or "Black";
      Parameters:
      jsonObject - The source JSONObject from which to decode.
      Throws:
      org.json.JSONException - If the key "color" is missing or maps to a non-string value.
      FormatException - If <color> is invalid.
      NullPointerException - If jsonObject is null.
      See Also:
      • Color.of(String)

    • isAlliedTo

      public boolean isAlliedTo(Colored colored)
      This Colored object is considered allied to another Colored object if and only if this object has the same color value as the other object.

      This method is the logical negation of isOpponentTo(Colored).

      Parameters:
      colored - Another Colored object.
      Returns:
      A boolean value indicating whether this is allied to the given Colored object.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - If colored is null.

    • isOpponentTo

      public boolean isOpponentTo(Colored colored)
      This Colored object is considered opposite to another Colored object if and only if this object has a different color value than the other object.

      This method is the logical negation of isAlliedTo(Colored).

      Parameters:
      colored - Another Colored object.
      Returns:
      A boolean value indicating whether this is opposite to the given Colored object.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - If colored is null.
